skill.name: bioservices
skill.description: Primary Python tool for 40+ bioinformatics services. Preferred for multi-database workflows: UniProt, KEGG, ChEMBL, PubChem, Reactome, QuickGO. Unified API for queries, ID mapping, pathway analysis. For direct REST control, use individual database skills (uniprot-database, kegg-database).
skill.summary: Primary Python tool for 40+ bioinformatics services. Preferred for multi-database workflows: UniProt...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Legitimate bioinformatics skill with 4 executable Python scripts that query public biological databases. Network calls target known bioinformatics services (UniProt, KEGG, ChEMBL, NCBI). Filesystem access is limited to user-specified input/output paths for analysis results. No environment access or external command execution.

content.value_statement: You need to retrieve biological data from multiple databases without writing custom API code. This skill provides ready workflows for protein searches, pathway analysis, and identifier mapping across major bioinformatics resources.
actual_capabilities: Search UniProt for proteins and retrieve FASTA sequences
Run BLASTP similarity searches via NCBI service
Discover KEGG pathways linked to proteins and genes
Map biological identifiers between databases in batch
Cross-reference compounds across KEGG, ChEBI, and ChEMBL
limitations: Depends on network access to external bioinformatics services
BLAST searches require valid email address and can be slow
Pathway analysis scripts write output files to specified directory

use_cases.title: Protein analysis workflow
use_cases.description: Retrieve a protein sequence, run BLAST, and list related KEGG pathways in one workflow.

use_cases.title: Compound ID mapping
use_cases.description: Map a KEGG compound to ChEBI and ChEMBL identifiers for downstream analysis.

use_cases.title: Teaching pipeline demo
use_cases.description: Demonstrate a multi-database bioinformatics pipeline using ready scripts and clear outputs.

prompt_templates.title: Find a protein
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the UniProt entry for ZAP70_HUMAN and summarize the organism, gene names, and sequence length.

prompt_templates.title: Run BLAST
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a BLASTP search for this sequence and summarize the top hits and organism distribution.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze pathways
prompt_templates.prompt: Find KEGG pathways linked to UniProt ID P43403 and list the pathway names.

prompt_templates.title: Batch convert IDs
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a list of IDs
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert a batch of UniProt accessions to KEGG IDs and save a CSV mapping file.

output_examples.input: Summarize KEGG pathways for the human ZAP70 protein.
output: Found KEGG gene ID hsa:7535 for UniProt P43403
Identified 4 pathways: T cell receptor signaling, B cell receptor signaling, NF-kappa B signaling, Primary immunodeficiency

best_practices: Provide specific database codes and identifiers when possible
Use the limit option when scanning many pathways to avoid timeouts
Store outputs in a dedicated folder for each analysis run
anti_patterns: Do not pass sensitive data in query strings to external services
Do not assume all biological IDs will have successful mappings
Do not run BLAST without a valid email address as NCBI requires it

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code when bioservices Python package is installed.

faq.question: Are there usage limits?
faq.answer: External services may rate limit requests. Use chunking and delays for large batch operations.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing pipelines?
faq.answer: Scripts produce CSV and SIF files that work with downstream tools like NetworkX and Cytoscape.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: Queries are sent to external bioinformatics services. Output files are saved locally by the scripts.

faq.question: What should I do if a request fails?
faq.answer: Check network access, verify identifiers exist, and retry with smaller batches or limit options.

faq.question: How does it compare to single database skills?
faq.answer: Focuses on multi-database workflows and cross-references rather than single service control.
